cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest toward the Louisiana coast, then forecast to turn west-northwest and track inland along or just north of the northern Gulf Coast toward east-central Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana coast (around Morgan City LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA; Ocean Springs MS to the MS/AL border; Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Morgan City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Tropical Storm Warning: Cameron LA to west of Morgan City LA and Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward to Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Only a low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; strongest gusts most likely to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water level rises (generally less than 1 ft) possible along the upper Texas coast; significant surge not expected at Galveston.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could drop 1–3 inches of rain Monday night through Tuesday, producing brief street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf beginning Monday.
